name: Hemisphere
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
body:
### Welcome to GitHub Pages.
This automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here using GitHub Flavored Markdown, select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new branch:

```
$ cd rupeshtelang/hemisphere
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

### Design
The creation includes the automated CSS3 numbering and alternate styling( i.e. Alternate units of the same element will have different styles). Hovering over the `<div>` makes it spin in such a way that is looks like its a hemisphere. Thats the beauty of **CSS3**.


### Authors and Contributors
The author, Rupesh Telang (@rupeshtelang), is a rising developer with HTML5, CSS3 and jQuery. He has done many projects in C, C#, php and java and still crafting many of them.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
tagline: Hemisphere : CSS Numbering and Alternate Styling
